tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE statistics_table (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    dataset_id INT,
    mean FLOAT,
    median FLOAT,
    std_deviation FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE statistics_table (
   id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   data_attribute VARCHAR(50),
   mean FLOAT,
   median FLOAT,
   std_deviation FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE dataset (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
numeric_attribute1 FLOAT,
numeric_attribute2 FLOAT,
numeric_attribute3 FLOAT,
string_attribute VARCHAR);

CREATE TABLE statistics (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
mean FLOAT,
median FLOAT,
std_deviation FLOAT,
dataset_id INT REFERENCES dataset(id));

CREATE TABLE data_analysis (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
dataset_id INT REFERENCES dataset(id),
statistics_id INT REFERENCES statistics(id),
analysis_status VARCHAR);

CREATE TABLE summary_results (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
summary_type VARCHAR,
summary_value FLOAT,
statistics_id INT REFERENCES statistics(id));
CREATE TABLE dataset ( id INT PRIMARY KEY, age INT, salary FLOAT );
CREATE TABLE mean_summary ( mean_age FLOAT, mean_salary FLOAT );
CREATE TABLE median_summary ( median_age FLOAT, median_salary FLOAT );
CREATE TABLE std_dev_summary ( std_dev_age FLOAT, std_dev_salary FLOAT );
CREATE TABLE summary_statistics ( id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, mean_age FLOAT, mean_salary FLOAT, median_age FLOAT, median_salary FLOAT, std_dev_age FLOAT, std_dev_salary FLOAT );
